futureRoles.name: Engineering Operations
futureRoles.briefDescription: Helps build engineering team processes at scale

description.html:
Engineering Operations are expected to work closely with the Director and Associate Director of Engineering, working with high-level goals and operations and creating a strong foundation to foster community among engineering managers, developers & engineering bootcampers.

Responsibilities

  • Work closely with Engineering Exec to plan engineering centric initiatives and events.

  • Work with Engineering Exec to evaluate and improve engineering applications and recruitment

  • Document team growth, member feedback, and engineering tools for management, organization, and end-of-semester review

Who are we looking for?

  • Like every other role in Bits of Good we are always looking for yellow jackets passionate about social good

  • Technical experience is not required, however, if you do have technical experience or want to improve your technical ability then we do have technical tasks you can take on!

Time commitment: 2-6 hours per week, including hour-long general meetings and meetings with engineering directors.

Note: If you cannot make our general meetings in-person on Tuesdays at 6:30 PM, you will not be eligible to join our organization

  • Document team growth, member feedback, and engineering tools for management, organization, and end-of-semester review
Who are we looking for?

Time commitment: 2-6 hours per week, including hour-long general meetings and meetings with engineering directors.Note: If you cannot make our general meetings in-person on Tuesdays at 6:30 PM, you will not be eligible to join our organization

description.html:
Those with entry-level programming experience, but little exposure to web development. Join if you're excited to learn about web technologies, or you're just hyped to make an impact in the social good space!

  • Follow along with our online curriculum, completing activities as we go

  • Attend our workshops twice a week

  • Attend office hours to catch up on missed material, or for concept clarification

  • Get jazzed to work on team projects and help out your peers

Time commitment

4-5 hours per week, including 2 in-person workshops
